title: Special Program visa (subclass 416)
summary: This page provides information about the Special Program visa (subclass 416), which has been closed to new applications since 19 November 2016. It explains the rights and obligations of existing visa holders and outlines sponsorship obligations for approved sponsors.

visa_info.description: Information for people who have already been granted a Special Program visa (subclass 416).

visa_holders.purpose: Explains rights and obligations for current visa holders.
visa_holders.vevo_usage: Visa holders can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check visa details and entitlements.

visa_validity.validity_period: Specified in the special programme agreement
visa_validity.notes: Validity includes arrival and departure arrangements.

allowed_activities: Take part in an approved special programme
Work or study in Australia if part of the approved programme

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Perform only activities listed in the visa application
new_application_required_if: Participating in different activities than those listed in the original application
Undertaking activities for an organisation not identified in the application

sponsor_information.audience: Approved sponsors of Special Program visa holders

obligations: Notify the department when certain events occur
Not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Secure an offer of reasonable accommodation
Pay travel costs for sponsored persons to leave Australia

applicant_definitions.primary_sponsored_applicant: Person the organisation intends to employ or engage in a specified occupation, program, or activity
applicant_definitions.secondary_sponsored_applicant: Family member of the primary sponsored applicant

inspection_purpose: Determine whether an illegal worker has been hired
Explore circumstances for possible administrative action

obligation_period.start: Day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.end: Five years after approved sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases

cooperation_examples: Producing and providing requested documents within required timeframes
Not preventing access to a person with custody of records
Allowing officers to interview any person on premises

notify_events.description: Sponsors must notify the department in writing when certain events occur.
events_requiring_notification: Primary sponsored person is unable to meet programme requirements
Primary sponsored person is unable to participate in the programme
Primary sponsored person ceases participation before program end
Primary sponsored person fails to attend a programme

notification_period.start: When standard business sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
notification_period.end: Two years after sponsorship or agreement ends AND sponsor is no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: Keep records showing compliance with sponsorship obligations
Some records must be independently verifiable
Maintain written requests for outward travel cost payments
required_travel_cost_record_details: For whom the costs were paid

obligation_period.end: Two years after sponsor is no longer approved AND no longer sponsoring anyone

provide_records_and_information.requirement: Sponsors must provide records or information requested by the department.
purpose: Assess other circumstances allowing administrative action by the Minister
conditions: Must provide records the sponsor is required to keep
Must provide records legally required to be provided to other agencies
